What is unit testing?

Unit testing is a level of software testing where individual units/components of a software are tested. The purpose is to validate that each unit of the software perform as deigned. A unit is the smallest testable part of any software. It usually has one or a few inputs and usually a single output.

What is Mocha?

Mocha is a testing framework for NodeJS which allows developer to easily test their code Mocha is one of the most popular NodeJS testing framework.

How to install Mocha?

            # global install
            npm install mocha -g
            
            #project install 
            npm install mocha --save-dev

How to use Mocha?

  • 1. Create a directory called test at the root of your project
  • 2. Create test files in test folder with following format "something.test.js"
  • 3. Update package.json
    •                 "script": {
                    "test": "mocha"
                }
  • 4. Run test
    • npm run test
Sample test code
            const assert = require('assert');
            describe('Simple math test',()=>{
                it('Should return 2'. ()=>{
                    assert.equal(1+1,2)
                })
            });
